item.title: Tech-Checklist for PhD students in Statistics
item.description:
Explanation and Introduction

Disclaimer: my personal experience

First Week?

At the Start

High-Priority

  • Department-specific: get e-mail, join all mailing list, check department website, cloud storage
  • Group-specifics: Slack, MS Teams, Zoom
  • Note-taking system: notebook, TeXing everything, Org-Mode
  • Working paper?: iPad (with GoodNotes?)/Paperless etc.,
  • free Software: Mathematica, Matlab (??), STATA
  • computational resources: how to access the cluster
  • reference manager: Zotero
  • LaTeX: Overleaf, Emacs
  • Text editor: Emacs, vim (helpful for all sorts of programming)
  • Online seminar lists: OCIS, ISSI, Chamberlain seminar
  • R-programming IDE
  • Python-programming IDE

  • Website: static builders: Hugo Blox, Jekyll

Overview

  1. The Hugo Blox website builder for Hugo, along with its starter templates, is designed for professional creators, educators, and teams/organizations - although it can be used to create any kind of site
  2. The template can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It’s a good platform for anyone looking to take control of their data and online identity whilst having the convenience to start off with a no-code solution (write in Markdown and customize with YAML parameters) and having flexibility to later add even deeper personalization with HTML and CSS
  3. You can work with all your favourite tools and apps with hundreds of plugins and integrations to speed up your workflows, interact with your readers, and much more
